titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Colgate Dorr Papers 1912-1944
titlestmt.subtitle: Dorr, Colgate Papers Mss. Acc. 2009.586

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by Ute Schechter, 2009

frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Colgate Dorr Papers, 1912-1944 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2009.586
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;
Processed By
Special Collections Staff.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Colgate Dorr Papers, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 12/10/2009.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Seller bought collection from the estate of Colgate Dorr.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and minimally processed in December 2009 by Ute Schechter, Warren E. Burger Archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki:http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Colgate_Dorr

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are 4 letters of then 2nd Lt. Colgate Dorr (1920-2006) written to his parents between September and November 1944, while stationed in San Francisco, California and then Hawaii during the last year of WW II; and a poem "'We Graduate to War, A Poem for the Class of '41' by Colgate Dorr, '41."Also included are two 1915 stock certificates and a 1912 postcard sent from Germany and addressed to Jessy (?) Colgate, Utica.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also Mss. Acc. 2009.585, Elizabeth E. Hoyt Composition Book, which was initially acquired from the same estate. The Hoyt and Dorr families intermarried in the earlier part of the 19th century.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
